intro: Diplotaxis virgata f. aissae, commonly known as the Aissah's doublestalked cress, is a flowering plant native to parts of Africa. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, which includes many economically important crops and weeds. The plant is characterized by its erect, branched stems and small, yellow flowers arranged in racemes. Its leaves are alternate and pinnately divided, giving it a distinctive appearance. It is often found in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid environments.
